response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("Age/Male", "high", "Being a young adult male is consistently associated with higher recidivism risk due to behavioral and social factors."),
    ("Criminal History", "high", "Two arrests and a conviction indicate a significant criminal history, strongly predicting future recidivism."),
    ("Employment Stability", "medium", "Holding only one job in a year suggests limited job stability, which may contribute moderately to recidivism risk."),
    ("Educational Status", "low", "Having a high school diploma and being enrolled in college is a protective factor, reducing recidivism risk to some extent."),
    ("Social/Family Life", "medium", "Living alone and never having been married may indicate lower social support, moderately increasing recidivism risk."),
    ("Childhood Environment", "medium", "Growing up in an urban setting with non-traditional guardianship can contribute to risk but is not determinative on its own."),
    ("Religious Beliefs", "medium", "A lack of belief that God influences personal outcomes might be associated with reduced adherence to societal norms, moderately increasing risk.")
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 75
}

risk_factors: Being a young adult male is consistently associated with higher recidivism risk due to behavioral and social factors.
Two arrests and a conviction indicate a significant criminal history, strongly predicting future recidivism.
Holding only one job in a year suggests limited job stability, which may contribute moderately to recidivism risk.
Having a high school diploma and being enrolled in college is a protective factor, reducing recidivism risk to some extent.
Living alone and never having been married may indicate lower social support, moderately increasing recidivism risk.
Growing up in an urban setting with non-traditional guardianship can contribute to risk but is not determinative on its own.
A lack of belief that God influences personal outcomes might be associated with reduced adherence to societal norms, moderately increasing risk.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 22-year-old male who identifies himself as White. He has been arrested 2 times and has been convicted. He is 6 feet 3 inches and weighs 190 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He has a high school diploma and is enrolled in a 2-year college. He has held 1 job during the year. He has not used any drugs in the past four years and has not felt depressed over the past month. At a young age, he lived with adults other than biological, foster or adoptive parents in a household of size 4, in an urban area. He considers that God has nothing to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
